intro: Glinus lotoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, tropical climates and is often found in wetlands or disturbed soils. Glinus lotoides is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
